cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, then forecast to arc north across Louisiana and Arkansas before turning northeast across the mid-Mississippi and lower Ohio Valleys and exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to the northwest Gulf Coast (TX-LA shoreline); none for the Great Lakes region
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings in effect from San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; none for Illinois
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from Freeport, TX eastward to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Illinois site listed in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (<34 kt) possible as remnant low passes south of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (Ottawa is far inland and upriver)
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain possible late 27 Aug – 28 Aug, totals generally 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river rises and localized ponding on terminals; marginal risk of an embedded tornado can’t be ruled out but threat is low this far north
